alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 9:28PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jewell, northern Smith, northeastern Phillips, Franklin and western Webster Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 928 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bladen to Campbell to near Upland to near Hildreth. Movement was south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Franklin around 940 PM CDT. Bloomington and Riverton around 945 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Red Cloud and Inavale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
